channel.title: Seafood on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Seafood on Table41NYC

item.title: Grand Central Oyster Bar
item.description: Pretty decent. Worth this 1 time trip and that’s about it. The oyster pan roast was alright. The soft shell crab was pretty decent too. I think I’d get the clam chowder over the oyster pan roast.

item.title: Simply Hooked
item.description: This used to be in the Lower East Side, but I guess they set up shop in this Gansevoort Market area. It wasn’t that good. I prefer the A Salt & Battery place instead.

item.title: Hot N Juicy Crawfish
item.description: Got the soft shell poboy. Was decent for lunch. $17 for fries, drink, and a poboy. The normal stuff is rather expensive. Probably a $2-3 per pound markup compared to LA.

item.title: Lobster Press
item.description: This is Marc Forgione’s fast food-ish restaurant near Penn Station. I got the chili lobster here, but it’s not as good as having it at the restaurant. It’s also CLOSED.

item.title: Greenpoint Fish and Lobster
item.description: Surprisingly good. The oyster shuckers did a good job keeping it juicy. Happy hour is cheap!

item.title: Flora Bar
item.description: Seafood centric. Ambience is good, but the food is eh.

item.title: Zadie's Oyster Room
item.description: Different cooking styles for all types of oysters. Was pretty good.

item.title: Cape House
item.description: Scallops and clam strips were good. Pickles were salty not sour.

item.title: Sunken Hundred
item.description: Good restaurant. I like the spanish octopus, fish churros, and pork chop. Unfortunately, it’s CLOSED.
